objects.name: PAP
objects.description: This defines PAP as a STIX extension

objects.name: Ruby Jumper
objects.description: APT37 is using a new suite of malware (RESTLEAF, SNAKEDROPPER, THUMBSBD, VIRUSTASK, FOOTWINE) to bridge air-gapped networks via removable drives. The infection starts with malicious LNK files and decoy documents related to the Palestine-Israel conflict.

objects.content:
Sector: Critical Infrastructure, Military, Research

Modus operandi:
Initial access via LNK files; use of Ruby interpreter for persistence; bidirectional C2 relay via hidden folders on USB drives.

objects.name: Operation Olalampo
objects.description: Iranian threat actor MuddyWater is targeting the MENA region using new malware variants like GhostFetch, GhostBackDoor, and a Rust-based backdoor named CHAR, controlled via Telegram bots.

objects.content:
Sector: Government, Critical Sectors in MENA

Modus operandi:
Phishing emails with macro-enabled Office documents; deployment of novel downloaders; use of Telegram for C2.

objects.name: CVE-2026-21902
objects.description:
Critical RCE in the On-Box Anomaly Detection framework of PTX routers. Unauthenticated remote attackers can execute code as root via a single packet.

Affected product: Junos OS Evolved

Affected vendor: Juniper Networks

CPE: cpe:2.3:o:juniper:junos_os_evolved:25.4:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2026-20127
objects.description:
Maximum severity authentication bypass in Catalyst SD-WAN platform. Actively exploited by threat actor UAT-8616 to insert malicious peers.

Affected product: Catalyst SD-WAN

Affected vendor: Cisco

CPE: cpe:2.3:a:cisco:catalyst_sd-wan:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: CVE-2025-13942
objects.description:
Critical command-injection vulnerability in the UPnP service. Allows unauthenticated remote attackers to execute OS commands via crafted SOAP requests.

Affected product: EX3510-B0 router

Affected vendor: Zyxel

CPE: cpe:2.3:h:zyxel:ex3510-b0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*

objects.name: Breach: Cegedim Santé / French Patients
objects.description:
The medical data of 15 million patients in France was compromised via Cegedim's 'Mon Logiciel Médical' (MLM). Stolen data includes administrative details and some sensitive medical notes.

Sector: Healthcare

objects.name: Breach: ManoMano
objects.description:
European DIY platform ManoMano suffered a breach via a third-party provider, exposing personal data (names, emails, phones) of 38 million customer accounts.

Sector: E-commerce

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / SIM Binding Mandate in India
objects.content:
Sector: Telecommunications, Privacy

Theme: SIM Binding Mandate in India

India is enforcing continuous 'SIM binding' for encrypted apps like WhatsApp, Telegram, and Signal. Ostensibly for cybersecurity against fraud, critics view it as a device-level surveillance mechanism that forces re-authentication every 6 hours.

Tags: India, Surveillance, Privacy, SIM Binding

objects.abstract: Geopolitical analysis (EN) / US Government Purge of Anthropic
objects.content:
Sector: Artificial Intelligence, Government Policy

Theme: US Government Purge of Anthropic

President Trump ordered a purge of Anthropic AI software from federal systems, labeling the company as 'woke' and a 'supply-chain risk' following disputes over AI safeguards for military use.

Tags: USA, Anthropic, AI Policy, Trump

objects.name: Aeternum Botnet - Blockchain C2
objects.description:
A botnet that uses Polygon blockchain smart contracts for its command-and-control infrastructure, making it highly resilient to traditional takedowns.

Analysis:
The use of Polygon's smart contracts for instruction storage ensures the C2 remains permanent and reachable via public RPC endpoints.

Recommendations:
- Filter outgoing traffic at the edge to block connections to known public RPC endpoints if not required for business.

objects.name: Trojanized Gaming Utilities Campaign
objects.description:
Attackers are distributing trojanized gaming tools (Xeno.exe, RobloxPlayerBeta.exe) to deliver a stealthy Remote Access Trojan (RAT).

Analysis:
The malware uses PowerShell and LOLBins like cmstp.exe for stealth, excludes itself from Microsoft Defender, and sets up persistence via scheduled tasks.

Recommendations:
- Monitor for unauthorized Microsoft Defender exclusions and scheduled tasks pointing to uncommon directories.

objects.content: The threat landscape for late February 2026 is characterized by a critical concentration of vulnerabilities in networking and security infrastructure (Juniper, Cisco, Zyxel, SonicWall) and a significant surge in large-scale data breaches impacting the healthcare and e-commerce sectors (Cegedim, ManoMano). We observe a professionalization of AI-assisted fraud, notably with the 'OnlyFake' platform, and a shift toward decentralized C2 infrastructures using blockchain (Aeternum botnet). State-sponsored groups like APT37 and MuddyWater remain highly active, targeting air-gapped systems and the MENA region respectively.

objects.name: CTI Report (EN) - 2026-02-28
objects.description: Aggregated CTI report for language EN
